description: Three supervised on-campus tests in weeks 4, 7 and 10 using pre-released question banks. Tests focus on practicing questions quickly/accurately with immediate feedback. Each test worth 15%.
8 weekly tests with Maple software components. Best 6 of 8 results count. Includes unlimited attempts with instant feedback. Focus on basic skills and mathematical software use.

Two-part individual assignment: Part A analyzes interdisciplinary math applications from videos; Part B involves writing solutions to exam-style questions with peer assessment. Emphasizes written communication skills.
Supervised 2-hour exam during official exam period testing advanced problem-solving, mathematical modeling, and novel application of techniques. Requires 50/65 pre-exam marks for eligibility.
